titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 791) to amend the National Trails System Act to designate the route of the War of 1812 British invasion of Maryland and Washington, District of Columbia, and the route of the American defense, for study for potential addition to the national trails system.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-210, by Mr. Hastings (WA).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 791 with 11 hours and 11 minutes of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. makes in order the Committee on Resources amendment in the nature of a substitute as an original bill for purpose of amendment. Measure will be considered read. Bill is open to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 78.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 232.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/29/1999--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (open) for the consideration of H.R. 791 (Star-Spangled Banner National Historic Trail).
